documents.name: Causal Inference for the Brave and True
documents.description: The best free intro to causal inference. DiD, IV, RDD, synthetic control — all with Python code you can run. No fluff.

documents.name: The Effect
documents.description: DAGs that don't suck. Nick HK explains causality like he's at a whiteboard, not a lectern. Free, modern, and actually enjoyable to read.

documents.name: Causal Inference: The Mixtape
documents.description: Scott Cunningham's guide — reads like a conversation, not a textbook. Code in Stata, R, and Python.

documents.name: CausalML (Uber) Documentation
documents.description: Synthetic data tutorials that feel like a game. Generate fake users, apply treatment, challenge yourself to recover the effect using Random Forest.

documents.name: EconML Documentation
documents.description: Microsoft's library for ML-based causal inference. Tutorials on heterogeneous treatment effects, double ML, and more.

documents.name: DoWhy Library
documents.description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Great for understanding causal graphs and robustness checks.

documents.name: Causal ML Book (Chernozhukov et al.)
documents.description: Applied Causal Inference Powered by ML and AI. Double/debiased ML, heterogeneous effects, and modern methods from the pioneers.

documents.name: DoWhy User Guide
documents.description: Microsoft's causal inference library. Graph-based causal inference, discovery algorithms, and Python implementations. Free official docs.

documents.name: PyMC Labs Blog
documents.description: Bayesian causal inference done right. MCMC, probabilistic programming, and causal models from the PyMC team.

documents.name: CausalPy
documents.description: Synthetic controls that feel like scikit-learn. Built on PyMC, perfect for quasi-experiments when you can't randomize.

documents.name: Andrew Gelman's Blog
documents.description: Stats, causal inference, experiment pitfalls. Frank, often funny, always insightful. The most-read stats blog for good reason.

documents.name: Applied Econometrics Notes (Lal)
documents.description: Applied econometrics notes and code by Apoorva Lal covering modern causal inference methods.

documents.name: A Practitioner's Guide to DiD
documents.description: Jonathan Roth et al.'s comprehensive guide to modern difference-in-differences. Staggered timing, pre-trends, and new estimators.

documents.name: Causal RL Bridges
documents.description: Educational resource on the synergies between causal inference and reinforcement learning. Includes code examples for optimal control using causal agents.

documents.name: Eppo's Experimentation Guides
documents.description: Practical guides on experiment design, stats engines, CUPED, and common pitfalls. Written by practitioners.

documents.name: A/B Testing on Social Networks
documents.description: Simulates a social graph in Python to prove why network effects ruin experiments, then shows cluster-based fixes.

documents.name: DoorDash: Switchback Tests
documents.description: Why treating one user affects another in marketplaces. Clear diagrams explaining interference as a living organism, not a static dataset.

documents.name: Understanding Switchback Experiments (2024)
documents.description: A modern take on SUTVA violations. Why you randomize time, not users, in marketplaces. The 30-minute window trick explained.

documents.name: Uber: Making Experiment Evaluation 100x Faster
documents.description: When your p-value calculation has billions of rows. The engineering reality of running causal inference at Uber scale.

documents.name: Nextmv: Switchback Testing
documents.description: Documentation that reads like a tutorial. Exact logic to split time into windows and washout periods for network A/B tests in Python.

documents.name: Matteo Courthoud: Understanding CUPED
documents.description: The most accessible yet rigorous CUPED explanation. Derives the math showing variance reduction is proportional to (1-ρ²), compares with autoregression and difference-in-differences. Perfect for economists.

documents.name: Bytepawn: CUPED in Python
documents.description: Short, punchy script simulating 1,000 experiments to prove variance actually goes down. Very satisfying to run.

documents.name: Statsig Resources
documents.description: Deep dives on sequential testing, variance reduction, and experiment analysis. Free stats engine docs.

documents.name: Evan Miller's A/B Testing Tools
documents.description: Best-in-class visual, interactive calculators for sample size, chi-squared tests, sequential sampling. Cited in Udacity's Google A/B testing course. Helps practitioners understand 'under the hood' statistics while planning experiments.

documents.name: Evan Miller: How Not To Run an A/B Test
documents.description: The article that taught the industry why peeking at p-values is a sin. Short, lethal, career-saving.

documents.name: QuantEcon Lectures
documents.description: High-quality computational economics in Python and Julia. Dynamic programming, time series, asset pricing — all with code.

documents.name: Coding for Economists
documents.description: Arthur Turrell's practical guide. Python basics through advanced workflows — built specifically for econ researchers.

documents.name: The Missing Semester (MIT)
documents.description: Command line, Git, debugging, shell scripting. The CS skills they don't teach in econ PhD programs but you absolutely need.

documents.name: Beyond Jupyter
documents.description: Software design principles for ML applications. Go from messy notebooks to maintainable, modular code with OOP essentials and refactoring guides.

documents.name: fast.ai Practical Deep Learning
documents.description: Train a model in 10 minutes. Understand why it works later. Jeremy Howard's famous 'code first, theory second' approach to deep learning.

documents.name: Introduction to Statistical Learning
documents.description: The 'I actually finished this one' ML book. Free with runnable Python code. Math when you need it, intuition first.

documents.name: The Elements of Statistical Learning
documents.description: The more rigorous sibling of ISLR. Hastie, Tibshirani, and Friedman's classic on statistical learning theory. Free PDF from Stanford.

documents.name: Forecasting: Principles and Practice
documents.description: Rob Hyndman's free book on time series forecasting. ARIMA, ETS, hierarchical forecasting — with R code.

documents.name: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction
documents.description: Sutton & Barto's classic. The definitive RL textbook, free from the authors.

documents.name: OpenAI Spinning Up

documents.tags: paper, Zhuojun Gu, Ravi Bapna, Jason Chan, Alok Gupta, 2022
documents.authors: Zhuojun Gu, Ravi Bapna, Jason Chan, Alok Gupta

documents.name: Digital Interventions and Habit Formation in Educational Technology
documents.description: Large-scale randomized experiment (10,000 learners) showing contest-based interventions increase engagement by 45% and create persistent habit formation effects (75% higher engagement 12 weeks post-intervention). Cutting-edge field experimental evidence from leading economists.
documents.tags: paper, Keshav Agrawal, Susan Athey, Ayush Kanodia, Emil Palikot, 2024
documents.authors: Keshav Agrawal, Susan Athey, Ayush Kanodia, Emil Palikot

documents.name: Empirical Support for a Causal Relationship Between Gamification and Learning Outcomes
documents.description: Provides causal evidence linking gamification to outcomes mediated by behavioral changes. Validates Landers' theory of gamified learning with empirical evidence—important for understanding mechanism design.
documents.tags: paper, Paul Denny, Fiona McDonald, Ruth Empson, Philip Kelly, Andrew Petersen, 2018
documents.authors: Paul Denny, Fiona McDonald, Ruth Empson, Philip Kelly, Andrew Petersen

documents.name: Customer Attrition Analysis for Financial Services Using Proportional Hazard Models
documents.description: Comprehensive Cox proportional hazards application to customer churn with time-varying covariates. Demonstrates how demographic, environmental, and behavioral variables predict retention. Over 600 citations; foundational for survival analysis in marketing.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions
documents.tags: paper, Dirk Van den Poel, Bart Larivière, 2004
documents.authors: Dirk Van den Poel, Bart Larivière

documents.name: How to Project Customer Retention
documents.description: Develops the shifted-beta-geometric (sBG) probability model for contractual settings. Accounts for customer heterogeneity in retention rates and provides forecasts for tenure, lifetime value, and customer base valuation. Essential methodology for subscription businesses.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions
documents.tags: paper, Peter S. Fader, Bruce G.S. Hardie, 2007
documents.authors: Peter S. Fader, Bruce G.S. Hardie

documents.name: A Competing Risks Model Based on Latent Dirichlet Allocation for Predicting Churn Reasons
documents.description: Novel competing risks survival model predicting both churn propensity and churn reason. Incorporates text analytics (LDA) from customer service transcripts to distinguish service-provider-driven versus competitor-driven churn. Modern integration of NLP with survival analysis.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions
documents.tags: paper, Dorenda Slof, Flavius Frasincar, Veljko Matsiiw, 2021
documents.authors: Dorenda Slof, Flavius Frasincar, Veljko Matsiiw

documents.name: Random Survival Forests with Competing Risks Framework
documents.description: Combines machine learning (random forests) with competing risks methodology. Computes distinct risk profiles for different churn causes and identifies relationships between risks and customer behavior for targeted interventions.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Survival Analysis for Subscriptions
documents.authors: Applied to Subscription Churn

documents.name: Manage Marketing by the Customer Equity Test
documents.description: Introduces the customer equity concept and decision calculus for balancing acquisition versus retention spending. Origins of viewing customers as assets. Over 1,000 citations; bridges practitioner and academic perspectives.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods
documents.tags: paper, Robert C. Blattberg, John Deighton, 1996
documents.authors: Robert C. Blattberg, John Deighton

documents.name: Return on Marketing: Using Customer Equity to Focus Marketing Strategy
documents.description: Unified strategic framework enabling marketing options to be traded off based on projected financial return, operationalized as change in customer equity. Key contribution linking marketing decisions to shareholder value through customer equity.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods
documents.tags: paper, Roland T. Rust, Katherine N. Lemon, Valarie A. Zeithaml, 2004
documents.authors: Roland T. Rust, Katherine N. Lemon, Valarie A. Zeithaml

documents.name: Valuing Customers
documents.description: Demonstrates how CLV can value firms including high-growth firms with negative earnings. Shows 1% improvement in retention improves firm value by 3-7%, while margin improvement yields only ~1% increase. Validated on Amazon, eBay, Capital One, E*Trade data.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Customer Base Analysis & Cohort Methods
documents.tags: paper, Sunil Gupta, Donald R. Lehmann, Jennifer Ames Stuart, 2004
documents.authors: Sunil Gupta, Donald R. Lehmann, Jennifer Ames Stuart

documents.name: Social Effects on Customer Retention
documents.description: Landmark study using data from 1 million cellular customers showing exposure to a defecting neighbor increases churn hazard by 80%. Establishes that social contagion affects retention similarly to adoption. Foundational paper for network effects on churn.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention
documents.authors: Irit Nitzan, Barak Libai

documents.name: Social Interactions in Customer Churn Decisions: The Impact of Relationship Directionality
documents.description: Extends social effects research by analyzing directed networks. Finds that only contacts the customer initiates communication with influence churn decisions. Demonstrates importance of relationship directionality and recency of neighbor churn.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention
documents.authors: Michael Haenlein

documents.name: Exploring Peer Effects Associated with User Retention in a Socially Connected Business
documents.description: Uses gym membership data to study bidirectional peer effects in usage and churn. When high-centrality users churn, cascade effects increase average un-subscription by 7.2% within 6 months. Provides targeting guidance: short-term strategies should target low-centrality users; long-term should target high-centrality.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention
documents.authors: Yijun Chen, Nitin Mehta

documents.name: In Pursuit of Enhanced Customer Retention Management: Review, Key Issues, and Future Directions
documents.description: Comprehensive review from 12 leading CRM scholars covering social connectivity's role in retention. Synthesizes literature on network externalities in multiplayer gaming, communications, and shared services. Identifies research frontier for network-oriented retention.
documents.category: Subscriptions & Retention > Network Effects on Retention
documents.tags: paper, Eva Ascarza, Scott A. Neslin, Oded Netzer, Zachery Anderson, Peter S. Fader, Sunil Gupta, Bruce G.S. Hardie, Aurélie Lemmens, Barak Libai, David Neal, Foster Provost, Rom Schrift, 2018

documents.description: Derives revenue-maximizing auctions and optimal reserve prices via 'virtual value' concept. Essential for understanding how platforms set reserve prices. ~6,400 citations.

documents.authors: Yuan Deng, Sébastien Lahaie, Vahab Mirrokni

documents.authors: Santiago R. Balseiro, Yonatan Gur

documents.authors: Vincent Conitzer, Christian Kroer, Eric Sodomka, Nicolas Stier-Moses

documents.name: Pacing Equilibrium in First Price Auction Markets
documents.description: Theoretical justification for industry's transition to first-price auctions (Google 2019); proves unique equilibrium and efficient computation via Eisenberg-Gale program.

documents.authors: Vincent Conitzer, Christian Kroer, Debmalya Panigrahi, Okke Schrijvers, Nicolas Stier-Moses, Eric Sodomka, Christopher A. Wilkens

documents.description: Google's framework for measuring incremental ad impact using geographic experiments.
documents.authors: Jon Vaver, Jim Koehler

documents.description: Novel methodology for measuring ad lift without holdout using predicted ad exposure.
documents.tags: paper, Garrett Johnson, Randall Lewis, Elmar Nubbemeyer, 2017
documents.authors: Garrett Johnson, Randall Lewis, Elmar Nubbemeyer

documents.name: Challenges and Opportunities in Media Mix Modeling
documents.description: Google's approach to marketing mix modeling with Bayesian methods.

documents.authors: Yuxue Jin, Yueqing Wang, Yunting Sun, et al.

documents.name: Consumer Heterogeneity and Paid Search Effectiveness: A Large-Scale Field Experiment
documents.description: Landmark eBay experiment showing paid search ROI vastly overestimated—99.5% of brand keyword traffic substitutes to organic. Demonstrates critical importance of experiments over observational methods. ~800 citations.

documents.authors: Thomas Blake, Chris Nosko, Steven Tadelis

documents.name: The Unfavorable Economics of Measuring the Returns to Advertising
documents.description: Analyzes 25 large RCTs ($2.8M spend) showing massive sample sizes needed for reliable ad measurement due to individual sales volatility (CV of 10). Explains why selection bias is 'crippling.' ~700 citations.
documents.tags: paper, Randall A. Lewis, Justin M. Rao, 2015
documents.authors: Randall A. Lewis, Justin M. Rao

documents.name: A Comparison of Approaches to Advertising Measurement: Evidence from Big Field Experiments at Facebook
documents.description: Compares RCTs to observational methods using 15 Facebook experiments (1.6B impressions). Demonstrates observational methods consistently fail even with rich behavioral data. ~500 citations.
documents.tags: paper, Brett R. Gordon, Florian Zettelmeyer, Neha Bhargava, Dan Chapsky, 2019
documents.authors: Brett R. Gordon, Florian Zettelmeyer, Neha Bhargava, Dan Chapsky

documents.name: TV Advertising Effectiveness and Profitability: Generalizable Results from 288 Brands
documents.description: Border-strategy identification across 288 brands finds TV ad elasticity of ~0.025—much lower than prior estimates; 80%+ of brands show negative marginal ROI.
documents.tags: paper, Bradley T. Shapiro, Günter J. Hitsch, Anna E. Tuchman, 2021
documents.authors: Bradley T. Shapiro, Günter J. Hitsch, Anna E. Tuchman

documents.name: An Experimental Investigation of the Effects of Retargeted Advertising: The Role of Frequency and Timing
documents.description: Large-scale RCT showing retargeting increases website returns by 14.6%, with effectiveness decaying over time (33% of impact on day 1) and advertising complementarities across weeks.

documents.name: Personalization in Email Marketing: The Role of Noninformative Advertising Content

documents.authors: Navdeep S. Sahni, S. Christian Wheeler, Pradeep Chintagunta

documents.description: Trade-offs between ad targeting precision and user annoyance.
documents.authors: Avi Goldfarb, Catherine Tucker

documents.description: How digital advertising affects consumer search behavior and market outcomes.

documents.authors: Xiang Hui, Maryam Saeedi, Zeqian Shen, Neel Sundaresan

documents.name: How Well Does Advertising Work? Generalizations from Meta-Analysis of Brand Advertising Elasticities
documents.description: Definitive meta-analysis of 751 short-term and 402 long-term advertising elasticities from 56 studies (1960-2008). Average short-term elasticity: 0.12; long-term: 0.24. ~440 citations.

documents.authors: Raj Sethuraman, Gerard J. Tellis, Richard A. Briesch

documents.name: How TV Advertising Works: A Meta-Analysis of 389 Real World Split Cable TV Advertising Experiments
documents.description: Classic BehaviorScan meta-analysis showing only ~50% of TV ad weight tests had positive sales effects; established that copy/strategy changes matter more than budget increases. Foundational paper.

documents.authors: Leonard M. Lodish, Magid Abraham, Stuart Kalmenson, Jeanne Livelsberger, Beth Lubetkin, Bruce Richardson, Mary Ellen Stevens

documents.name: Privacy Regulation and Online Advertising
documents.description: Foundational empirical paper showing EU privacy regulation (ePrivacy Directive) reduced display ad effectiveness by 65% in changing purchase intent. ~2,500 citations.
documents.tags: paper, Avi Goldfarb, Catherine E. Tucker, 2011
documents.authors: Avi Goldfarb, Catherine E. Tucker

documents.name: The Effect of Privacy Regulation on the Data Industry: Empirical Evidence from GDPR
documents.description: Shows GDPR's opt-in led to 12.5% drop in tracked consumers, but remaining consumers are more valuable—demonstrating 'privacy externalities' where privacy-conscious consumers make opt-in consumers more predictable.
documents.tags: paper, Guy Aridor, Yeon-Koo Che, Tobias Salz, 2023
documents.authors: Guy Aridor, Yeon-Koo Che, Tobias Salz

documents.name: Privacy and Market Concentration: Intended and Unintended Consequences of the GDPR
documents.description: Panel data on 27,000+ websites shows GDPR reduced vendor use by 15% but increased market concentration by 17%—large platforms (Google, Facebook) gained share as small vendors dropped.
documents.tags: paper, Garrett A. Johnson, Scott K. Shriver, Samuel G. Goldberg, 2023
documents.authors: Garrett A. Johnson, Scott K. Shriver, Samuel G. Goldberg

documents.name: The Economic Consequences of Apple's App Tracking Transparency
documents.description: Quantifies ATT's economic effects: 37% reduction in CTR for Meta's conversion-optimized ads; firms with higher Meta dependence experienced 37% revenue decline. Smaller e-commerce firms disproportionately harmed.
documents.tags: paper, Guy Aridor, Yeon-Koo Che, Brett Hollenbeck, Daniel McCarthy, Maximilian Kaiser, 2024
documents.authors: Guy Aridor, Yeon-Koo Che, Brett Hollenbeck, Daniel McCarthy, Maximilian Kaiser

documents.name: Economic Consequences of Online Tracking Restrictions
documents.description: Studies 128M ad impressions over 2.5 years; average cookie lifetime is 279 days with €2.52 value. One-year cookie restrictions would cost €904M annually in Europe. IJRM Best Article Award 2024.
documents.tags: paper, Klaus M. Miller, Bernd Skiera, 2024
documents.authors: Klaus M. Miller, Bernd Skiera

documents.name: Online Display Advertising Markets: A Literature Review and Future Directions
documents.description: Comprehensive literature review organizing display advertising research by ecosystem agents (advertisers, publishers, intermediaries). Essential reading for understanding the programmatic landscape. ~200 citations.
documents.tags: paper, Hana Choi, Carl F. Mela, Santiago R. Balseiro, Adam Leary, 2020
documents.authors: Hana Choi, Carl F. Mela, Santiago R. Balseiro, Adam Leary

documents.name: Repeated Auctions with Budgets in Ad Exchanges: Approximations and Design

documents.authors: Santiago R. Balseiro, Omar Besbes, Gabriel Y. Weintraub

documents.name: Real-Time Bidding in Online Display Advertising

documents.name: First-Price Auctions in Online Display Advertising
